Reviews:
Benson here again, continuing my reviews of USB Type-C legacy cables, adapters, and accessories. Today I am reviewing Otium's USB Type C to Micro USB Adapter, Otium USB Type C to Micro USB Adapter. This adapter is a MicroUSB female to Type-C plug adapter, putting it in the class of devices known as "Legacy Host Adapters." This product comes in a convenient 2 pack.

Let's check spec compliance :
I'm using my trusty Chromebook Pixel 2015 with the Chromium Twinkie USB-PD Sniffer, available on Amazon from Plugable : Plugable USB 3.1 Type-C (USB-C) Power Delivery Sniffer

For my first test, I've got the Otium MicroUSB Adapter plugged into a good quality (itself capable of >2.4A) Micro-B cable from Belkin. (this one: Belkin 6-Foot 2.0 USB Type C (USB-C) to Micro USB Charge Cable, USB-C Certified) That is then plugged Apple proprietary (MacBook) charger capable of 5.2V at 2.4A.

The Type-C end is plugged into Twinkie, acting as a pass through to Chromebook Pixel 2015. Picture attached!

First let's run the ectool command from Pixel's command line to check what Pixel thinks is happening on its USB-C ports :
localhost ~ # ectool --dev 1 usbpdpower
Port 0: SNK Charger Proprietary 4612mV / 2400mA, max 5000mV / 2400mA / 12000mW
Port 1: SRC

So far so good. Pixel identifies the charger as a Proprietary type adapter, and has negotiated 2.4A.

Let's see what Twinkie (the USB PD sniffer) says :
> tw cc
CC1 = 18 mV ; CC2 = 421 mV

The tw cc command reads the current voltage values from the CC pins. As you can see here, CC2 pin has a value of 421mV. Referring to the USB Type-C Specification Table 4-25 Voltage on Sink CC pins, this voltage falls right in the middle of the range allowed for vRd-USB, meaning that yes, this MicroUSB adapter has the correct 56k' pullup resistor!

One more Twinkie command :
> tw vbus
VBUS = 4750 mV ; -2440 mA

The tw vbus command uses twinkie's current and voltage meter ability. As you can see, the laptop is pulling just around 2.4A of current at 4.750V from the Apple charger over the Belkin cable + Otium adapter.

For a HighSpeed USB 2.0 data test, Iâ€™ve hooked my Nexus 5X to my Chromebook Pixel via the Otium MicroUSB adapter + Belkin cable to test large file transfer via MTP. It just works, no problem!

Now for more subjective judgments of this adapter : The Type-C plug on this adapter is a stamped metal part that's been wrapped around to the shape of the plug. It does have a seam on one side. This is good, but not great like the stronger deep-draw plugs from other manufacturers including the Google and Apple 1st party plugs. What definitely makes the Otium adapter stand apart from other adapters like it though is the shell, which is anodized aluminum and a step above the plastic shells of similar adapters. It feels durable and fits in with the all aluminum bodies of Pixel devices, Nexus 6P, and MacBooks.

In conclusion : A high quality charging and data sync MicroUSB Adapter from Otium! The adapter is a great safe way to breathe new life into your old A-to-MicroUSB cables for use with newer USB Type-C devices such as Nexus 6P/5X or Pixel devices. It is also future proof for fast charging USB Type-C devices to come!

These are a nice temporary way to get around getting a new phone that adopted yet another "universal standard" which means all your old chargers and accessories are garbage. I buy Android phones to get away from the Apple experience of proprietary connectors release every other generation, but now I get the full Apple experience with a different user interface.

EDIT: this review was written for a different product than it now shows. I bought an adapter piece for USB cable types, not these headphones. My star review has changed because of this which seems like a dirty sneaky practice.

These adapters work great for converting all the existing micro USB cables into USB-C for the new devices in our house. We recently upgraded to the LG G5 and the Nexus 5X. However we also still have a number of other items (Amazon Kindle, Kindle Fire HDX, Kindle Fire 7, etc.) that need to be charged via micro USB. This is a great solution. The only problem I see is these are so small they can be lost when removed from the micro USB cable. Perhaps a small zip tie or lanyard that can be secured to the cable so you know they're always on the cable?

These set of three Micro USB-C type Charging Adapters were purchased to cap off some or my regular USB chargers in order to connect to my Galaxy Note 7. They fit well and are quality made. However, be aware that they do not provide data transfer, just charging of your phone.
I have no problem with these adapters, and do recommend them. The price is reasonable.

Ordered this because of the positive review by Benson Leung.

When the product arrived, one of the two adapters didn't work (wasn't charging my wife's Nexus 5x). I sent a message to OtiumDirect, and they sent me a replacement free of charge. The replacement works great.

Overall, a really nice product, especially for the price, and very good, responsive customer service. I highly recommend this product.

Recently changed my phone and was thinking about buying a USB-A and USB-C cable but since I had tons of micro USB cables, I figured buying this adaptor will save me some money.
So I bought this based on the famous Google engineer's review. There are so many similar products and that was the only way to find the proper one. The product itself is actually good quality but be careful as it comes in a small package and I almost threw it away with a garbage.
Anyway, I am overall satisfied with this adapter. I recommend this product.

I bought a different set of adapters previously and only got 90ma from a 1ft micro USB cable plugged into a 1.5A USB socket, switched to these and get 1.3A with my Nexus 5X phone which is on par with the Nexus 5. So this is a must get if you are using USB Type C with Micro USB cables.

I purchased "USB Type C to Micro USB Adapter (2 Pack) OtiumÂ® USB-C to Micro USB Female Convert Connector for New Mackbook 12", Google Chromebook Pixel, Nexus 5X /" and the link brings me to this page.

The adapters never worked. I bought more USB C cables and gave the old cables away instead.

Great way to use old Micro USB cables. It could be my imagination that they don't charge as fast as true USB C cables or it could be a safety thing since Micro USB cables might not be up to the task. Either way they work.

These work great if you have any new samsung. adapts to fit old plug. I dont think it charges quite as fast as with the original charge but work great if you need a charge and dont have the original cord
One of the few that really work with any cable. It will not allow a "turbo charge" from my micro usb cable charger, but it will allow transfers. It is a very sturdy connector!

Great for charging my OnePlus 2. Haven't tested if it does data or not, but I only bought them to use on some existing cables for charging purposes & in my car in case someone without USB-C needs a cord. Works wonderfully.

Haven't tested specifically, but data transfers speeds will suffer from this, but at this price point, they are well worth the buy. As with most new standards, once the market catches up, usb-c cables will be much more available for everyone.

Good size (a hair over 1in long, fairly transparent during actual usage), and saved all my micro usb cables from being useless.
2 adapters in 1 pack (1 in the car and 1 on my desk)
Will probably buy more for other places.

I didn't realize the Nexus 5X used USB Type-C when I upgraded from my Nexus 5 a couple months ago. This thing solved the problem though. I just leave these two attached to my car and portable power brick unless I need to remove them for anything else. Their small size makes them super portable - which is nice until you forget them in your jeans and they go through the wash and dry cycle - whoops. But hey, it still works! Not bad for a tiny little thing.

I was pleasantly surprised at how small and compact this adapter is. It will be easy to keep several on hand and stowed away in my laptop bag, car glove box and desk drawer so I'll always be able to charge my phone with any of the numerous micro-usb chargers that I own. I'm impressed with the quality of this adapter. The case is made of metal and it appears to be precisely manufactured and durable The micro-usb plug fits very snugly into this adapter so it won't fall out. I gave the adapter a quick test by plugging in a micro-usb cable in and using it to charge my Nexus 6p phone. My Nexus 6p charged just fine and the Current Monitor app showed the charge_type as a fast charge. I like that the adapter came in a 2-pack. Another huge pro for this adapter is that it is "Benson" tested and approved. I wouldn't purchase a USB-C adapter, charger or cable without that important qualification.

I received this product at a discount for evaluation in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

I have 3 different chargers for the devices but even then, it's is annoying to deal with as it is the only device I own with USB-C. Having to own a separate cable to charge this device can become a burden. I use a slingbag every day but for others, it's not something they do so carrying a charging cord for their devices might be difficult if you have more than one standard.

This product comes in to help deal with the situation. I've tested on many micro usb cables and all have been able to charge my tablet just fine. I tested plugging in the micro usb cable to a PC and was able to access my files so data does work with this adapter. The fact that it comes with two is even better. These things are tiny and can be lost easily so I'd prefer to have a back up. Anyone with a USB-C device that still uses many other devices with micro USB should get one of these adapters. They'll save your life when in need of a charger.

This product says that it is sweat resistant and again up to this point it was working fine. Read the details, look at other options if you want something that's going to last more than 2 months.

Once fully charges I could not (nor could anyone else) pair these to any smart phone/ ipod. All the devices used never picked up the earbuds. Disappointing.

These were by far the greatest pair of headphones I have ever had. They were extremely light weight, I would forget they were in my ear or around my neck. The sound was truly amazing and when using the mic to talk outside in the wind there was no distortion or wind noise over the mic which is a problem I've had with other hands free devices.

With that said, I have had them for about a week now and have used them mildly. I have had trouble charging them, after having them plugged in over night it appears to be fully charged but after a song or two I get the low battery warning and they shut off. Also the control unit on the head phones themselves has started to gets extremely hot while briefly in use.

Sadly I am going to be returning them, preferably for a new pair but if not a refund. I really hope that it's just my pair that's malfunctioning and not the standard product.

When the box says "Lighter weight" they were not kidding. I originally wondered if anything was even in the box because it was so light. They come with a carrying case that clips using a carabiner. I always like when items come with cases so you can keep all the cords and accessories together. I can clip it on my purse handle and use the headphones any time I go out. The sound quality is really nice. No complaints. And the headphones charge up in less than 2 hours. Comes with 3 sizes of ear buds so you can find the right fit to your ears.

Very satisfied and definitely recommend them to others.

I had to get another pair because my son stole mine! These come with several sized fittings so they fit both mine and my son's ears perfectly - which is very hard to find. The rubber looping tucks under the ear fold to keep it secured in place. I was worried about the magnets being too heavy and causing them to fall out but that is not the case. He runs with these in and has zero problems. If you've had any kind of Bluetooth earbuds these are really about the same to pair them to your phone/tablet. There is the volume up and down buttons and the multi function button. You just hold it until the white and orange light alternate, at that time your device is ready to be paired with earbuds. Just make sure your Bluetooth is turned on on your device.

These charge with an included USB and there is a notification on your device that shows you how much battery life is left - a feature I really like. It charges fully fairly quick and the charge lasts for several days of average usage.

The sound is perfect and very clear. Zero static or interference noise. It really blasts loud on max volume and is still quite clear on min volume.

Brand: Otium

Model: Magnetic Bluetooth Wireless Headphones

Overall Rating: 6/5

Introduction

Ok, so the thing is I love headphones, like, to the point that I buy new headphones just to have new headphones, not necessarily because I need them. You know, some people like purses, others like cats, I love headphones. A few days ago I decided to order three new pairs of headphones, and get a replacement for an old pair that broke. Yes, that's right, I ordered four pairs of headphones. Guess which one I've listened to? That's right, these. Guess which one I'm listening? That's right, these. Guess which ones are sitting in a pile somewhere, that's right, not these. So, without further ado, let me do what I can to paint a word picture that does this beautiful sound machines justice.

Product Description

The headphones are your standard Bluetooth headphones in appearance except they have a remote on their right side. Bluetooth earbuds typically either a) hook on your ear, b) have a necklace that they hook to, or c) have a remote on one side. I have about four of model a), they're great but annoying when I want to listen to one ear only (which is quite often), so I don't tend to use them. I have two pairs of option b), but the battery doesn't last very long so I don't tend to use them. I believe I have about three of model c), and they are typically my preferred method. The remote is nice because it's easily accessible, the buttons are easy to navigate, and it's great.

These headphones also have a little tab that helps them stay in your ear very well and very comfortably. Seriously, the only reason I took them off recently was the battery died, not because of discomfort. The battery, by the way, lasted my first time for about 4-5 hours, but I do not think that was a full charge.

The magnetic part is cool and all, quite strong actually, but not extremely useful. It does help when you're putting the headphones away as they tangle much much less than normal headphones, but why would you put these headphones away? They sound so great I'd prefer to just keep them on.

In terms of audio quality, I literally cannot convince you enough how great they sound. Nearly every set of bluetooth headphones I own have this slight distortion sound to them. They either sound like someone blew out the speakers ever so slightly before sending them to me, or that the speakers need to be broken before they sound great. The thing is, the sound never goes away. My (previous) favorite pair even had that sound, but they had great sound on top of that so I did not notice much of a difference. Guess what are the first pair of Bluetooth headphones I've owned that don't have that annoying background noise (that possible only I can hear)? That's right, these ones.

On top of not sounding slightly distorted, these sound about as good as my all time favorite pair (Sony Extra Bass earbuds), except those were wired, designed by a sound company, and had the worlds best grips. These headphones compete with my audiophile headphones while being Bluetooth and having crappy grips. Yea, the grips are nothing great. They're not bad, but I've definitely had better. Most people won't care though to be honest, or even notice a difference by the way.

Again, I highly recommend these headphones. Honestly, these are truly wonderful headphones and I am absolutely glad I bought them. They are basically the headphones I have been wishing I had since I lost my old Sony headphones (Rest in Peace where you are!) and are officially my new favorite headphones.

Conclusion:

The best pair of headphones I currently own. Highly comfortable, great sound, awesome headphones.

These earbuds are the best I've ever used, and that includes the iPhone earbuds that come with all Apple products. The sound is great! They stay in my ears during long, sweaty runs, and they're easy to adjust volume and turn on/off. It does take quite a long time pressing the on/off button for them to actually turn on/off so you have to keep them in your ears and wait for the buds to tell you they're connected or disconnected but it's not bothersome.

I don't really need the extra little piece of silicone that keeps them in your ear, but that's probably useful for some people. I've used these for about 2-3 months almost daily at the gym while working out, running, walking, etc as well as outside on walks. They do a great job of staying in the ear and delivering great sound.

I haven't used them for phone calls so I can't speak on that part but as a bluetooth sound delivery system, they're perfect. They even come delivered with charge so you can use them right out of the box! I use them about 30-60 minutes per day and get about a week or two out of every full charge. That works very well for me. Great product!
love these headphones they are really comfortable and versitile great to be used anywhere any time connects to bluetooth.

I love these magnetic headphones! They have many accessories and fittings to find just the right fit for comfort! They come with a compact durable carrying case as well! The sound quality is amazing! Great bass and the highs mids and lows are all on point! They are light weight and extremely comfortable! I highly recommend these to anyone looking for a clear crisp and concert like headphone experience with the convenience of sweat resistance!
These ear buds are excellent. Easy to work, holds a charge for a long time and comfortable. Great value!
Great price, great sound-

Shape and feel, but that alone can't make these worth the buy. I normally switch to my old pair with a cord for reliability.

The cord that connects the two earbuds is long enough so you don't feel like one wrong neck move will make the earbuds come out, but also its spaced far apart enough that you don't feel like you may accidentally rip them out of your ear while jogging. I bought these earphones to use during field work and for general excercising. First thing I should say is that I was immediately impressed by the quality of the earphones. it is impressive

The sound is not bad on these and the connection seems to extend pretty good before it drops. But these lasted 2 weeksish and now are totally dead. They won't charge, the won't connect, I tried multiple cords nothing works. I was listening to music at work, went on lunch and plugged them in to charge so when I came back, they would be good to go and totally dead. The charge is only good for about 4-5 hrs which is why I charge them on my break. I did it the same way everyday and today dead. Sucks cause I like to listen to music while I work. Nothing crazy happened while at lunch, no storms, power flicker nothing. I am giving two stars because the functionality was not bad when they worked. Glad it happened while I could still return them. Buy at your own risk.

For example when the headphones are being used they kind are spread out and it just looks a bit awkward when the wire is so spread out. Just wished there was a adjustable clip because that would really give this product that finishing touch. Overall this product is very satisfying!

Kinda sucks had it for not even 2 weeks before it broke and since i didnt pay the warranty im out of luck great otherwise and good noise canceling

Overall okay headphones. They work well for the price and have a relatively long battery life. However, the charger cord that they came with doesn't actually fit and won't charge them. I had another one from a different device that I tried and it happened to work, but otherwise I would be unable to use them. Also, they cut out sometimes for seemingly no reason. The headphones themselves are fine, but the charging cord issue is ridiculous.

The sound quality and battery life on these earbuds are surprisingly good! Overall Iâ€™m very pleased with them for the price. I mainly use them at the gym or listening to music/podcasts while doing chores at home. I can usually go a room or two away from my phone without noticable static, which is great.

The only reason I give 4 stars is that none of the loops that came with them were a good fit for my ears - they all seemed too big and just didnâ€™t fit properly. All of them make my ears sore after about 20-30 minutes, so I donâ€™t use them. They stay in place pretty well without the loops, so this isnâ€™t a deal breaker. Sound quality is really good - but the build feels overly cheap even at this price point. Feels like it would break after a few weeks of use. Ended up returning and picking up one of the competitors for a few more bucks but feels far more durable.

They're good, but they have an odd effect on the bluetooth capacity of the iPhone7. The phone could not detect the earbuds until I reset them AND forgot the other bluetooth devices that had been paired with my phone. Then, my phone couldn't detect my bluetooth headphones until I made it forget the earbuds. Basically, the phone can never have both in memory and whenever I want to switch back to the earbuds I ALSO have to reset them, which is annoying. It's 2018 people. This should be easy.
Another stupid thing is that the instructions for the reset are useless. I had to contact customer service and the instructions he gave me were not the ones given in the manual but they worked. Update the manual so that customers don't have to go out of their way to extract information from the company.

Okay, not great. The chord behind the neck catches on my shirt and when I turn my head, they will yank in my ear so that's uncomfortable, I'm not sure if this is an issue with just these or any other similar style, I have not tried any others.

Pairing can be a bit of a pain. I was unable to reliably use them with my windows 8 laptop. And if you're thinking about pairing with laptop and phone and being able to switch between the two, forget about it.

This is my first pair or wireless and they are great. I use solely for the gym and keep around the back of my neck. Completely out of the way and stay in ears. Only thing is it messes up calls - sometimes they go onto speaker but not into earphones. Only sometimes so I canâ€™t figure out why. But great earphone

Comfortable and reasonable sound quality. My main gripe is the terrible short battery life. My bad, but when running a half marathon they (being fully charged when I started) gave up after 90 minutes with "low battery". Would trade a litle more size for a bit more reasonable battery life.
Love these. Easy to set up. Nice and light, sounds pretty good for such a low price. I like the shape of the ear pieces, they stay in my ear great. I love the case that comes with it.

lovely , sound is crystal clear during phone call

When it comes to bluetooth headphones, these work well. Some parts of the function I don't understand. The back of the earbuds are magnetic. I would love for someone to let me know what the situation calls that would need for the earbuds to be connected together(as in the photo I posted). The control box has buttons for volume control, power button, and the usb charger. There is also a small hook that, for some unknown reason, hooks together the two sides of the wires. They do work really well. Sound quality is pretty good. They are easy to pair the bluetooth with your device. It also comes with a cute carrying case that can keep them safe while in bag and on the go. They are nice, I just personally feel that some of the features were not necessary.

This is what I use whenever I go to the gym. It connects to my phone right away after I turned on the Bluetooth which is a plus because my previous headphones take a while to connect. It took me an hour and a half to charge it for the first time which is okay. The sound is crisp and clear whether I use it for music or talking to someone over the phone. I haven't done any extreme running in the treadmill so I can't say if it sticks to your ears that much but overall in my experience it doesn't fall.

One thing I like about it is that it has a nice and sleek design casing. It also has some extra ear plugs if that's what you call.

I'll continue to use this headphone as it is.

sound: 8/10
durabiliry: 9/10
convenience: 6/10

good sound compared to higher end products, with the right mixture of trebble and bass they arent too "tinny" and are pretty comfortable to listen to especially if you use them with an equilizer app. The magnetic backs on the sizable drivers are convnvenient, but the one problem I have wih this product is that one earbud in and one earbud out just doesnt work. if you put the cord behind your neck, and let one earbud dangle on your chest, it slowly droops until it takes all of the cord and it limits your maneuverability until you pull the earbud highet up closer to your neck. if you try to put the earbud on top of your ear, the earbud again drops too far and you end up looking like a dingus. A simple fix for this is to include a small clip in the middle of the earbuds so you can clip then to your collar and they will not fall too far.

This is a fabulous set of earbuds. They did not come charged, but they were quick to charge, and then they connected to my android super easy. They came with such a cute carrying case too, which was an extra bonus. They sound wonderful, and they block out most of the outside noise, which is also great. I turned it up pretty loud, and I didnâ€™t hear any distortion. Overall, this is a great set of headphones!

I have owned multiple types of wireless Bluetooth headsets from multiple manufacturers and to be honest I have hated most of them. These Otium Bluetooth Wireless Headphones are a different story. I really like these headphones and have been using them everyday since I received them, and here is why:
-- They fit very well on my ears without falling off, and fit will within my ears as well.
-- The sound quality is much better than I expected. Lows are low and Highs are high.
-- They have a very professional appearance and look like a higher end product, compared to the price that I paid.
-- These headphones connect quickly and automatically to my device. With some of my other headphones it can be a battle.
-- Charges quickly (fully charged in less than 2 hours)
-- Once fully charges these headphones last for hours.

In conclusion, I would highly recommend these headphones to anyone who needs a great, high quality pair of Wireless Bluetooth Headphones that won't fall off of your ears while working out or while relaxing. I wear these headphones to listen to Binaural Sleep Meditation Music at night and they work great!

Used these worth my Android.

Have had wireless headphones before, and the other headphones had a loud beeping noise Everytime you pressed a button and I was super happy these didn't have that 'feature' however after using them a while I realized having that feature was helfpul as there is sometimes a delay between pressing play and the app actually playing. Without the beep sometimes I wasn't sure if I pressed the button or not. This was annoying but not a deal breaker.

Weird thing, these headphones would work to advance or rewind my audio books (it was reversed, you pressed volume up to rewind and volume down to advance) but it would not advance songs in Pandora or Spotify. Again annoying but not a deal breaker.

Battery life is great! Never had it die one during the day. I don't typically used them continuous but I use them for my hour to hour and a half commute each way and sporadically during my 8 hour work day.

The distance I could walk from my phone was much greater than my old headphones which was great. Noise isolation was also better than my old headphones.

Fit was also good. I recently lost these headphones though and given the relatively minor issues I listed above I will be looking for a different pair. However if I hadn't lost them, I probably would not have bothered to replace them.

Oh my goodness, shame on me for waiting to buy blue-tooth buds , I'm serious, since being a 3-4 time a week gym rat since 2011 and dealing with tangled cords or pulling cords out of your ears on a smith machine or pull-up, these buds are EXCELLENCE .

And I use them for over 90 minutes -2 x's a week and charge them to play it safe, but they have yet to run out on me.
Plus they sync in 2-3 seconds via your blue tooth phone
Once you click on they audibly notify you ( headset on ) and the same when you power off.
Also has a simple + - volume control near your right side.
Nice addition is the round zippered case and that the buds are magnetized back to back creating less tangles.

As soon as customer service tells me how to sync with my TV sound-bar via blue tooth I'll be ecstatic !

These are the most comfortable in-ear/wireless earbuds I've tried so far. The rounded loop seems to go "in" my ear with the least effort and I really like the magnetic clasp feature for when they're not in use. My only major complaint is power management. They don't seem to turn off automatically the way others I've owned do. One time I forgot I left them on while removing them to talk to a store clerk. An hour later when I got home and thought to check, sure enough, they were still on! For something so advanced, it seems pretty old-school to have to actively manage on/off power states...

I bought this because I do running after work and I need a pair of headphones to listening to music. Running with these headphones are really amazing, they will not fall out from your ears. Putting them in your ears doesn't get pain like the others that I've had. It's the best wireless headphones I've ever used! Nice looking! These are really comfortable even if I have it on for a long time, my ears do not have any irritation. Highly recommend!

These wireless buds are pretty amazing. The feel of the materials are definitely a quality found in higher end products. They stayed in my ears and didn't hurt me. Sound quality is excellent for the price. No issues with reception from or to the phone. I do wish they came with and clip so the wire wouldn't bounce on my neck when running.

Comes with and small, round zipper pouch, along with different size speaker covers with little extenders to help the buds stay in place. I usually have issues with the comfort of the extenders, but these are seemingly designed for me, the extenders are very flexible and soft but strong enough to stay put.

Awesome, best Bluetooth earbuds for the price, battery life lasts the entire day with mild usage, with continuous , say like at the gym, it lasts about 4-6 hrs. Volume gets pretty loud, I usually keep the volume around 50-70% and the audio can still be heard by someone next to me. Build quality is good and it fits snugly in my ears. The compact carrying case is great too. Only thing I didn't like is that the small black plastic piece that used to tie the wire together/ adjust the wires, comes off too easily. In fact, after the first week I already lost the plastic piece. Luckily it doesn't matter too much and I get by just fine without it, but it does suck that it came off so easily. I'll probably just end up making it or just 3D printing one myself when I get the chance. Overall this is a great product, obviously can't be compared to something like the jaybirds, but these are still great Bluetooth earbuds for the price. Hope this helps.

I've had two pairs of Phaiser Bluetooth buds and so far, both have broken on me- eventually a wire breaks and one ear goes out, and there's no fixing that. These sound just as good as the more expensive pair of phaisers for half the price. I'm not an audiophile so, while these surely aren't the best sound quality available, they're great for the price. I only use them to listen to podcasts and tunes at work where I'm surrounded by loud machinery, so that would all be wasted on me anyway.

These Earbuds are very unique! The design is different and also the way it fits into your ear. They sound crisp and get really loud. They fit inside instead of the traditional outside of the ear. If you can get used to the feel then you will like them. The way they are magnetized when hangin from your neck is great so that they don't go swinging everywhere. Nice buy

First, I love the magnet that keeps the buds together around my neck while I am not using them!! Easy to sync to my iphone and great sound quality. Nice price too. you can move away from your phone quite a bit before it starts breaking up. I go 2 rooms away with no issues! Then are very comfortable and don't pull in my ears. The charger looks durable. Nice product!

I really like the headphones. Great fit and they do not pop out of your ears...no matter how sweaty you get! I love the sound. Since I ride the bus there's a lot of noise and the headphones definitely give me the privilege to listen to my own music without any interruption. I love these wireless bluetooth earbuds, and they seem to do what's advertised. Good product!!

The earbuds are awesome. They look and sound good. Metal construction and light weight. I've bought many bluetooth earbuds but these really stand out. I listen to them at work. I work in a warehouse and i can get through the whole shift with one charge at 75% volume. I would definately recommend these earbuds. These earbuds are worth four times their price. You won't be dissatisfied.

I have several pairs of earbuds, each for different things. buy this one for my wife workouts. I bought this pair because of the over the ear design, hoping they would stay in better ,i feel The sound quality is good, the price was right, Pairing was simple and the controls are easy to navigate. Very happy with my purchase.

These have been my favorite ear buds so far. They are extremely comfortable and the sound is excellent. The charge actually lasts for a good amount of hours, I don't know maybe four hours of straight listening?....maybe more. They definitely stay in without budging during during sweaty runs, and that was my most important need, besides the sound of course. If these ever give out I will definitely be ordering them again.

These work great, the sound quality is good, and I love that they have magnets on them so if I need to take them out for a few minutes I won't accidentally lose them. I only wish the battery lasted a wee bit longer before needing a re-charge!

I usually have very little faith in Bluetooth headphones and am pretty much an AUX cord loyalist. These headphones showed me that a quality pair of BT earbuds can be made for under $50. Now, don't get me wrong, these don't hold a candle to more expensive wired sets, but these are pretty amazing for the price. And they don't look, feel or operate like they're cheap! Will be back for another pair when I (inevitably) lose them.

These are the most comfortable earphones I have ever owned. The ear loops are soft and flexible, the earbuds are at just the right angle to fit the ear properly, unlike most I have tried, where it goes straight into the ear. These earphones are so light and comfortable you almost forget they are even on. The sound is perfect. I am very satisfied with these and plan to buy more for use as presents. Thank you

Great earbuds. Crystal clear sound. For the price you can't go wrong. They even have a microphone! They fit very well and don't fall out even when I work out. These are definitely worth the money. I highly recommend!

I bought more than 3 Bluetooth headphones, I think this one is the best for noise cancelation. Also tonight I take it to the gym and spent almost two hours there, the headphones are still awake. I am very satisfied with this product.

Stays in ears better than jaybirds. Good quality sound. Connects with ease. The only reason not 5 stars is I wish the sound got louder. Great product for the money. Really worth it. Sound like a 100$ pair easily.

Love these Magnetic Design Bluetooth headphones,very easy to pair to my phone via Bluetooth,I use them during workout,it fit my ears very well,I have no problem to wear them while doing my workout,the magnetic design is fantastic,that can hold them to my neck while I am not listening.the sound is very good as well.
Recommend it.

So I have a pair of Powerbeats 3 that I got for Christmas. I am a chef and I wear one earpiece at a time. 3 months after I received them the left ear clip completely broke off. Powerbeats 3 have a 12 hour battery life which got me through so many rough times. I ordered these because I didn't want to pay 120 to replace my beats and they say the battery life lasts 8 hours listening/calling. I call bs. I fully charged these and they lasted 2 hours at most. I wouldn't order this product for the battery life and I'm sending them back for false advertising. Sound is not bad, but j can't charge my earbuds every 2 hours

These work well on devices that are compatible....they are comfortable and seem to hold a charge for a good amount of time. Evidently there are multiple bluetooth technologies and FireTv and FireStick use A2DP and these earbuds do not support this protocol.
My ears are still too small for these even with the smallest buds :( but I use it because I paid money but they fall out a few times while working out.

This are my husbands favorite wireless ear buds that we have. He uses them for everything from gaming, listening to music, and taking phone calls. I have used this bluetooth headphones for several days, and it meets all my needs.
Pros:
* It's equipped with wings which prevent the earphone from falling out of your ear.
*The sound quality is good enough at this price. I think it is at least as good as Apple's earpods (Not airpods, I don't have it...)
*Details of the earphones is perfect. Their factory does better job in the earphones' exterior than Bose. (Shame on Bose!)
Cons:
* I haven't tested it's battery life. It definitely can't last 24 hours (which Apple said they can). My estimation is about 7 to 8 hours.
*It is not completely water-resistant. The seller says it is sweat-proof which means it is safe with only a few water. It is Ok to me. I will not wear it while taking shower or swimming, but someone may.

Conclusion:
If you're look for a cost-effective wireless headphones, here it is. With 80% less price, you get 80% performance comparing to other famous brands' earphones.

I have had these headphones for a few days now and really love them. They are great for my active lifestyle. I have used them whil running, biking, lifting weights, and mowing the lawn. They have stayed in place perfectly.
They are comfortable and lightweight. They also pair very easily with my iPhone and sound great. I would strongly recommend.

This was my first time switching from wired headphones to wireless headphones since I have been listening to music via Iphone or Ipod. I wasn't really sure what to think since it was new to me but these headphones gave me a good opinion. They were very comfortable to wear and they fit inside the ear nicely. I wasn't sure how I would feel about something resting on me but it didn't bother me at all. The only con I had was that the part of the headphone on the cord with the power buttons and volume became a bit annoying as it sits on the back of my neck and was harder to access. Pairing the headphones was a breeze and have a pretty good battery life Overall sound quality was great. It was not dull or faded but sounds crisp and clean. I enjoyed these while I was working out and they never fell out or had any issues at all. I highly recommend them to anyone looking for a good pair of wireless headphones.

For the price you can't beat these Bluetooth neckband style earbuds. I have a few different brands of this style of headset. This one is by far the most comfortable. Many have an issue where the earbuds will fall out when you turn your head...these have long enough wires from neck and to earbuds that they do not pull out. They also connect to each other via magnets in the earbud portion.

The sound was good, but initial sound quality left a little bit to be desired on the bass end, but was certainly adequate at this price point. Connection was easy and quick with my phone and never dropped the signal throughout my use. I expect the sound to improve after a break in period.

I highly recommend them for anyone looking for a necband style headset.

Good headphone for running or doing other exercises! The design of it is perfect so it won't fall down when doing exercises. After charing, this headphone can almost last for three days for normal use.

Love these headphones. I can't even tell I have them on. Very lightweight, great sound, and an unbelievable price! I'm going to get a couple more pairs to give to my parents as gifts. They love them too.

This might be the Otium's best product yet. The SoundBuds Life model is remarkably well built and looks extremely modern and sleek. The audio, being my biggest concern, is actually very dynamic and clear. The bass, mids and highs are all well balanced and the volume is plenty strong enough. The noise cancellation was surprising.The controls are all intuitive, the construction being superb, so I don't foresee any major damage or part malfunctions. Everything is either encased or sealed. The product is completely worth the cost.Recommend!!

The Otium X6 was reduced a bit during the Prime Day sale, but it listed all of the qualities of comparible higher-priced bluetooth units, without any unbelievabe claims attached, so I felt it was worth the risk to order a brand I'd never heard of. I am very pleased with the materials and solid construction of this headset. The first unit sent proved to have a glitch in the control button response/funtionality, which unfortunately didn't resolve with extended use. Disclaimer; I haven't used the X6 for taking/making phones calls, since all phone calls do is interupt ones enjoyment of listening to music, sorry). After contacing OtiumDirect, they kindly and promptly provided a replacement X6 headset, which exhibited none of the symptoms of the first unit. The replacement was completely free from glitches and has operatedly flawlessly, so it gets the review. Since other reviewers have added good photos of this unit in their reviews, nothing could be added by duplicating their photography.

The X6 was packed well, in a form fitted plastic insert placed in the outer box, with 3 pair of various sized extra inner ear-tips below the insert, with a USB charging cord, warranty card and tiny manual (too small for me to read). The 'Airwings' hold the earphones in my ear and keep the headphones in the proper direction Although I don't jog or exercise with them, I suspect the 'Airwings' will be useful to those that do. The extra eartips will allow you to have a custom and comfortable fit. After an intial charge, the X6 paired effortlessly with the assistance ofvocal prompts. The magnetic attraction of the earphones keeps them from becoming unduly tangled when you set them aside. In practice, Bluetooth 4.2 definitely seems to have much-improved tonal qualities regardless of volume. The X6 battery life offers around a relistic 4-6 hour playback time, depending on volume used and program/music material. I'm unsure how many button presses for volume and track-changes affects battery life. The audio response of the X6 is amazing, considering it's price, It takes 40-80 hours to break-in a headset, but from the first time they were powered on, I've loved the sound of the X6. I never expected to hear such deep clear bass or crips mid and high range at any volume from a bluetooth set, much less at this price. The reception distance of the X6 is better than other Bluetooth sets I've owned, without any discernable dropout or lag when going from one room to the next. Even with a thin paneled wall between the source and X6, I found no sonic diffence. I've reached listening distances of approximately 35-45 feet from the tablet which should be plenty of range for most users. It doesn't matter which transmission source I use, the X6 receives easily, the exception was an ancient anidroid mini-tablet that kept dropping the signal. I love my closed AKG's for studio use, and my wired SkullCandy takes a close 2nd, but the Otium X6 is now my favorite wireless headset, hands-down. I can't think of a reason to pay more for any similar type of semi-wired/wireless design. Otium also offers completely wireless earpiece models which I'm interested in trying at a future date. Otiumobile.com's website was offline and difficult to reach, but when it was sorted out I was able to properly register the X6 for a longer warranty. The only gripe, was the extremely small lettering in the tiny manual; keep your magnifying glass handy, but at least it was included!

I'm happy to give both the X6 headphones and the distributer, OtiumDirect, an unrestrained 5-Star rating for a great product and for the courteous, prompt customer service thy've provided. I'm not a paid product endorser/reviewer; I always offer my honest opinion. Anyone who enjoys listening to music will enjoy having a set of these headphones, at such a great low price. I hope this review helps fellow Amazonians make good purchasing decisions.

Update: I still really like this headset, but after a couple weeks of use the recharge frequency has gone up. I only get about 1:30 to 2 hours of use between charges.

The headset includes 3 different size adapters to allow them fit comfortably in your ears. The headset is very light weight and I hardly noticed I was wearing them after a few minutes. The sound quality is excellent playing back clear high frequency and speech as well as great quality low frequency at low and high volumes. Unlike the "Otium Best Wireless Sports Earphones" that I also tested, these do not distort at high volume and delivers a clean crisp sound.

Although the booklet does not state this, the headset can pair to 2 devices at a time and it easily paired to my Pixel XL & Samsung S7 at the same time. If you receive an incoming while listening to music on your phone the music is paused and you get a notification played back for the incoming call as well as the calling number being read back to you. With the headset connected to my laptop and was able to use it for music as well as the audio device and microphone when making calls from the Skype for Business client.

The Bluetooth range on these are slightly better than the other model I tested, the booklet says 10 meters, but I was able to get about 20 meters away before losing audio. The box says sweat proof, but unlike the other model it does not state that it is waterproof in the booklet.

I am extremely impressed with this headset, very comfortable, easy to use excellent sound quality.

These are extremely comfortable right out of the box. I use these almost exclusively for the gym, and they're perfect for that. The headset itself is light in weight . The magnets built into the earbuds are pretty strong and have no problem staying together and keeping them around your neck when not in use. Please note, that the instructions say to hold the button for 1 second to turn them on, but for me, it was closer to 5 seconds. Calls are clear and people have no problems hearing me. So far battery life is excellent but this will totally vary on how you use these. I use for music maybe 2 hours a day and hours of phone calls. Right now i charge every other night regardless. These are really great for the price range and extremely easy to use and sync. I'm sure the sound isn't as great as more expensive ones, but for walking, jogging and working out, they get the job done, don't look bad, and fit well.
Above all, these are really good for the money, and I'd rebuy if they broke.

Update: sadly after about a the audio out of the right earbud stopped working after about 2 months. Should've gone with the BeatsX I guess ðŸ™

Just got these last week but I think I FINALLY found the perfect balance of quality Bluetooth headphones with a slim neckband and magnetic earbuds. After literally about 8 to 10 cheapish headphones I was really considering coughing up the $100 - $150 for some BeatsX (Depending on if I could catch them on sale). Just happened to come across these - which have a very BeatsX "inspired" design at a much more reasonable price. The main difference I can see us if course these don't have Apple's fancy new chip (w2 I think they call it) that connects to icloud and pair instantly with iOS devices. Oh yeah and these don't charge with a lightning cable. I'm willing to forego those couple of things to save about $125!!! SO glad I came across these. Battery life so far is great. Stylish design. I'm not a crazy audiophile but I'm happy with the sound and they are much better than other similarly priced headphones I've gone through.

I have been looking for a pair of Bluetooth earbuds that's light weight and low profile and most importantly long battery-life. Phone calls are crisp and clear. The mic also works great for me. They also sound great. They will turn off if not used after awhile if not connecting to Bluetooth to save the battery. The ear buds are very countable. They fit my ears perfectly. The magnet is super strong to keep the ear pieces rogether.

I haven't had these headphones for more than I week and will update my review if my opinion about them changes, or once I test battery life, but for now I can say that these are my favorite pair of headphones! I love headphones and have had several pairs of all kinds, shapes and technologies. The sound quality of these Otium headphones is great for the price and they are very comfortable. I like that the earbuds design keep them from falling off my ears and the location of the microphone allows people to hear me clearly. The controls are very easy to reach and not on the same side as the battery, which keeps the weight balanced. The magnets do a good job at keeping the earbuds together when not in use. At first I thought I would hate these because I don't like things around my neck, but they are so comfortable that I can't even feel that I'm wearing them. The only reason I didn't give them 5 stars is because the description is inaccurate. The manual says battery talk/play time around 8 hrs, while description says 10 hrs. Also, nowhere in the manual says that they are sweat proof. It actually tells you to avoid them from getting wet. I'm not sure exactly how long the battery lasts yet, because I haven't used them for many hours straight, but it does last a lot longer than my previous ones. Overall, these are great headphones and very affordable! I will most likely buy more if I don't encounter problems after having using them for some time.

Sounds good, on par with Samsung Level U Pro. Very lightweight. I wanted this one because the wires do not tug on my collared shirts like the Level U does because they have the wires reaching all the way to the back of the neckband. Also the Level U Pro gets my neck warm and sweaty because the battery right there at the back of the neck.

Range is not as good as the Level U Pro, but it's fine with me.
The magnet is very strong, unlike the Level U Pro which the buds keep coming apart.

Highly recommended over anything else.

I bought the headphones so that I could charge my iPhone 7 and listen to music at the same time. They seem to get the job done - sound quality isn't great, but holds a charge for most of the day. The speakers just don't sound pleasant. Very little low-end and just flat. Stock IPhone headphones sound way better, and they're not that great...

They do have a pretty decent range and the unit itself is reasonably light. The earbud fitment can be finicky, however. Not sure I'd recommend these to anyone other than to those who want something really cheap to use as a handsfree device.

It was easy to pair the headphones with my phone and the magnetic ends of each ear bud will definitely keep these from falling off my neck or at the very lease keep me from being aware that they did fall off. My only complaint is that the volume up, down and the power/pairing mode buttons are all the same size and I'd totally prefer a track to roll to change the volume instead.

These headphones will be used at work and should there be any issue with the item I will update my review.

The main reason I bought these is because they said it would work 9 hours without recharging. The next best I could find was 6 hours.

The first 5 months of use they worked great and I always had at at least 9 hours of listening without having to recharge. Then suddenly the ear bud on the side without controls started go in in and out. I found a way to get it to stay on, but if I moved it would go out again. A couple of weeks after that the other side started going out too. It's short was were the wire went into the hard part around the neck. The other side's short was were the cable entered the ear bud.

Considering the reviews of similar items I guess I'm lucky to have gotten 5 months of quality use out of this pair. I did use them several days a week during that time. But I expect more quality than that.

The first thing I noticed on this bluetooth headphone is that the headphone is very light. I feel like I don't have it in my neck when I'm using it. I have my old LG bluetooth headphone and that is heavy compared to this one. The magnetic earbud is a plus feature, it secures the headphone by connecting together when not in use and just hanging in my neck. The ear wings helps secure the headphone when I'm using it to prevent it from falling off when I'm in my threadmill. Another plus is the sound quality, I didn't have to crank the volume all the way up to get to my desired listening level. For the price and the good quality of this bluetooth headphone, I definitely will recommend it to my friends.

This wireless sports earphones are very nice... I bought this for my friends birthday and she really like this... it works perfectly.. the sound is very clear... included charger... higgly recomended...

Really happy with these so far. I've had them around a month or so and I've been impressed. As a woman with a narrow neck I was concerned that the fit would be really bad but they stay in place pretty well and really stay out of the way especially compared to other around the neck bands. I swapped out the earbuds for memory foam for preference but the original tips din't seem bad.

The ear fins move around quite a bit and I've actually had them fall off once. Not a deal breaker but sometimes causes problems if you take your headphones in and out a lot.

Battery is definitely not as advertised. I would say I get closer to 5 or 6 hours without turning them off but for price and fit, thats really not too bad.

I'll see how these hold up as time goes but so far I'm really happy with these and I'm ridiculously picky when it comes to my headphones.

I use my earbuds for phone calls, during long distance running, and while lifting weights and training. After testing many BlueTooth styles and brands I found the Otium "neckband" earphone design stays in my ears the most securely; isn't easily dislodged or lost; they don't interfere with most exercise body movements; and the batterylife is longer than any other BlueTooth earbuds I've seen. The Otium X6 was excellent for me and suited my needs perfectly!

The first set of Otium X6 earphones I purchased were excellent, but only worked for a few weeks. They stopped transmitting sound and would not hold a charge.
The second set of Otium X6 earphones I bought arrived with an unstable right ear connection, resulting in muffled sounds or none at all.

I am extremely disappointed by the poor quality and weak durability of the Otium X6. While I'm hopeful for a pair that will work, I'm hesitant to repurchase another set of X6 earphones.
I will be much more wary of any Otium products in the future.

These are pretty good! Not excellent, not great, but pretty good. For the price, they're a great value. The audio quality isn't very high, but if you're just using them for phone calls, podcasts, audiobooks, etc. -- they're fantastic. Music? For exercise they're fine, since quality isn't super important when you're jogging or riding your bike with all that road noise, etc., but otherwise -- these are comparable to $10 Skull Candy earbuds, as far as audio quality. Great for spoken word, not so great for music.

Battery life seems good -- 6-8 hours, depending on usage, but fine for me.

I do really like how they work with Siri on my iPhone, though -- just a double-tap of the center button and she's ready for me to ask her add something to my calendar or reminders list. The fit and finish is really nice on these as well. No weird, cheap, plastic whose finish kinda rubs off on your fingers after a while. Very solidly built and great for wearing around the house, the office, while exercising -- basically wherever, which is the point of these, right?!

Overall -- these are an excellent purchase and I've been using them for about a week now around the house, listening to podcasts. Really, really great for that!

So far I really like these. My old bulky set died and I was looking for a set that was lighter and smaller. I ordered 2 different brands and originally these were not my first choice because the ear bud wires come out the bottom of the necklace and there is no magnetic storage for the ear buds on the necklace. However, after using and listening to them I consider these the best set I have ever owned. The design is well thought out and they have a look and feel of quality. The 3 buttons are well separated, and easy to find with your fingers. I am no audiophile but I am very happy with the sound quality. The other brand that I bought sound a little bit "tinny" and are a little short on bass, but this set seems to have hit it just about right. The ear buds do hang down when not in use but they have strong magnets and lock together tightly. Supposedly these are designed to be sweat and water resistant as well. I really don't think you can go wrong with these, especially for the price. I am going to use these for a couple of weeks and if all goes well I will buy another set as a spare.

Iâ€™ve bought a fair share of Bluetooth headsets, I would lose them or the battery would last only for a few hours. Most of the time they are used when I run and it gets frustrating when these headsets donâ€™t work. This one just died and stopped working after a couple of weeks using.

Though there are some positives for this headset. I do like how the neck band isnâ€™t a huge piece of plastic and fits nicely around the neck. The ear buds fit comfortably in the ear and doesnâ€™t fall of when running. The magnets with the neckband will guarantee I wonâ€™t lose these headsets.

Now the negatives. My first time using them was amazing, actually it did stop playing for a few seconds, but thatâ€™s common with all Bluetooth headsets. After that these headsets brought the following problems: just stops playing, refuses to power on, volume suddenly turns down to 25%, and refuses to pair with device. Sometimes Iâ€™ll be running and no audio is coming out. I tried resetting, disconnecting the Bluetooth and pairing again, resetting my phone and none of these solutions work. It would suddenly works the next day to only cause one of the problems listed above.

Then it finally died, wonâ€™t power on or charge. Amazon was awesome and gave me a refund. I love how it fitted nicely and was secure just wished it work.

These headphones are great. They last a long time and I have yet to run out of battery. Although I've run very low on battery, they charged fully in less than an hour. The sound quality is good; I love bass and one of factors for me when I buy a pair of headphones is if you can hear or feel bass-most definitely can :-) I am confident that these will last a long time. The wire is stiffer which is awesome as they don't slide or pull to one side. The buds themself are comfortable & come with 3 sizes to fit snug along w/2 loops to hold securely. Pairing with multiple devices was idiot proof. These are definitely a great headphone at a very reasonable price

These headphones were great for a few months, I received then on October 1st, 2017, and at the end of February, the left headphone stopped working. It almost seems like there is a short where the headphone wire goes into the neckband. The cord here is very thin, and should probably be reinforced in some way.
Will not be purchasing these again, but would consider a different model by the same brand, because they were great while they lasted.

I have been hesitant to spend more than a little cash in a set of in-ear headphones because I seems to have smallish ears. Most in-ear buds or headphones are very uncomfortable (Beats, Apple Earpods, etc.). I took a chance and am very happy I did. These fit very snug, but flexible enough for long-term wear. They have a decent range, feel very light on the ears, have good battery life, and magnets design keeps it safe in a good place. Good bass response without sounding "woofy" like Beats. At this price, I highly recommend them.

I didn't realize how much I would love wireless headphone until I actually tried them. I admit that I'm late to the game, but as a runner, I finally became fed up with the cord sometimes pulling lose with a random arm swing or turn. I have found that these stay in place throughout my run and actually feel secure. Once they're in, I don't have to ever readjust them. Although I had to have someone younger than me show me how to pair the headphones to my phone, that's now done and I don't have to mess with it again. I simply turn the headphones on with the on button and I'm ready to go. The microphone works well when making calls and I've never had anyone tell me that they couldn't hear me clearly.

I used to use iPhone's original wire headphones. It was truly annoying to unwire them before use, and it was also frustrating that you have to use earphone and charge the phone at the same time.

Life has been a breeze since I get this product. No wires any more. Doesn't need to plug in any more and I can charge at the same time. I like the design that it rests around my neck. So the earphones are standing by neatly during intermittent usage. The sound quality is good too. Love it!

Absolutely do not recommend. Ended up returning them.

Pro: soft neckband, pretty okay bass, magnetic

Con: a full one-or-two-second fade in from silence every time there is a bluetooth blip or dropped data. It is infuriating and makes listening to audiobooks, podcasts, or voice chats (like in gaming) almost impossible. This was enough to make me want to return them, but the nail in the coffin was that when you receive a phone call, the headphones read out (slowly) the entire phone number before allowing you to answer.

I'm amazed these "features" weren't included in other reviews. They made these headphones almost completely unusable.

Even after buying this product I've been reading the reviews. Ill have to update if I have any issues with them. But so far I absolutely love these headphones. They are lightweight, rain proof, sound quality is amazing and battery life is good. I've had them for a week and I use them often, today was the first time I needed to charge them. These are comparable to the $120 BeatsX. $100 cheaper and the sound quality is just as good. I also purchased the 3 year Asurion warranty through Amazon, just in case anything does happen. Overall I would highly recommend, especially for the price.

Ive had these a few weeks. This is the 5th pair of Bluetooth earbuds I've tried, and my favorite so far. Very secure for jogging, comfortable, good sound, block outside wind/noise. Battery life seems good, but I don't push it past 4 hours before recharging because I hate batteries dying mid-jog. Also, the connection to my device is strong. Other headphones I've owned cut in and out when you're moving too much, or if your device is on the side of your body furthest from controls on headphones. These do not. And the neckband/weighted sides keep them secure so the cord isn't pulling toward the one side, as others have done. They're designed very smart. Solved all my other earbud issues. I recommend these!

These inexpensive headphones are simply incredible. So far I would give them 6 stars if I could. I use them on my motorcycle. I am literally able to ride down the Interstate at 80 mph and hear every word and every note. I used them to and from work today on my 40 mile commute, including 20 miles of Interstate each way. The noise cancelling is superb. It reduces the wind noise down to a level where the music comes through loud and clear. The wind noise is usually deafening, but with these little gems in I barely hear it. Be sure to use the correct size rubber tip for the best results, (three different sizes are included). I highly recommend them for motorcyclists. Just be careful and pay attention because you also barely hear the traffic around you. But that's what your eyes and your mirrors are for!

These sound pretty good, and they were surprisingly inexpensive for Bluetooth earphones, and they add some nice features, but because those features override standard behavior, switching between these earphones and normal ones can be a little frustrating.

Most audio programs for mobile platforms have a user-definable function for double-clicking the remote button. You can skip ahead a few seconds to fast-forward through podcast advertisements. You can jump back a few seconds in case you missed something in your audiobook. You can skip to the next track. Etc.

These earphones override that functionality and will only re-dial the last-called number on your phone when you double-click the "MF Button." However, they include a useful feature to rewind or fast-forward a little but by holding down the volume up or down buttons for a few seconds, giving you more flexibility once you get used to the non-standard operation.

Another minor annoyance is that if you pause the audio on your phone for awhile (for example, to finish writing/editing a review for the earphones), the earphones will automatically disconnect and reconnect to your Bluetooth device (e.g. phone) every so often, which is really jarring, because the "Disconnected.. pairing.. connected" voice prompts are quite a bit louder than they should be (that is, they're louder than most audio content you'll be listening to).

The issue with the voice prompt volume being too loud affects all aspects of these earphones - powering on, powering off, pairing, connecting, and disconnecting. They're just too loud and jarring, or when they're not, other content is too quiet.

They work ok except if you're talking on the phone with them. When you're on a call, they will randomly loose connection, say they are re-pairing, But, won't. Model: X6 Neckband Wireless Headphones

Overall Rating: 4/5 if they work, 1/5 currently.

Introduction:
I love headphones, I absolutely enjoy getting new headphones, trying out new headphones, and talking about headphones. I ordered these headphones along with another pair of Otium headphones and was fortunately able to try out both at the same time. Up until recently, these were my favorite pair of headphones. They currently, however, will not charge and so I cannot use them. It may be the cable I have to charge them, I will update this if trying a different cable helps.

Product Description:
These are Bluetooth headphones that consist of two earbuds wired to a necklace-like device that rests around your neck. The earbuds themselves have no buttons on them but there are three buttons on the right side of the necklace: volume down, a utility button, and volume up.

The length of the earbud cord from the necklace is plenty long enough to be comfortable while not being too long and awkward. The necklace is great if you are just listening in one ear as the other headphone will hang without dragging that ear out. Often Bluetooth headphones consist of two earbuds attached only via a cord, like Beats' popular model. While these are stylish, they are absolutely frustrating when using one headphone at a time as the non-used headphone will literally drag the other one out of your ear. For most people this isn't an issue as they are perfectly content ignoring the rest of the world, so two ears is fine with them. I like hearing people/sounds as I'm listening so unless I'm alone studying/reading I typically only use 1 ear at a time.

One more nice feature is that the volume down button is the first (and therefore easiest) button so that if the music is suddenly too loud you can quickly alleviate that.

The earbuds also have small rubber flaps designed to help them stay in your ear better. These are actually quite useful and, unlike some other headphones I've used, they actually stay on decently well. If the flaps bother you they are easily removable (or re-attachable if you change your mind) as you just slide the rubber ring on/off.

The headphones come with three different sizes of grips, but they are not very high quality grips. They work fine, don't get me wrong, but they're just the standard quality rubber.

Finally, the earbuds can magnetically stick together, which is semi-useful if you're wearing the headphones but not using them. By sticking them together they don't fly around as much.

Product Features
The headphones can easily connect via Bluetooth to my phone and laptop, at the same time if desired, and likely to additional devices. The necklace can adjust the volume by pressing the volume up/down buttons or change tracks by holding the volume up/down buttons. Power is controlled by holding the middle utility button, holding it turns them on/off. Pressing it once without holding pauses/resumes the music. Overall, most standard music controls can be achieved via the necklace without even looking at your phone/device.

In terms of sound quality, these are among the best cheap headphones I've ever used, and I've had about 20 pairs of headphones. In fact, until they stopped working these were my favorite pair to use. I even brought them to Kauai with me. I did, however, say these are among the best "cheap" headphones. My favorite pair of headphones was an old pair of Sony headphones called "Extra Bass headphones". They cost about $60, sounded beautiful, and the bass vibrated from them so well. These cost about $24 currently ($90 originally), but I would be willing to pay about $30 for them. They sound great but their range is not as wide as the Sony ones, they have great deep bass but not quite those of the Sony headphones or the other Otium ones, and they seal out sound well but again, not quite as well as the Sony ones.

In terms of battery life (before they stopped charging on me), they lasted about 2-3 hours or so. Honestly not the greatest battery for me, but they worked well enough and charge quickly enough that it wasn't a huge issue. The low battery life and poor quality grips were the main reasons I would give them a 4/5.

Pros:
Necklace with many controls easily-accessible.
Phenomenal sound for the price I paid.
Earbuds designed to stay in ear.
Earbuds can clip together to prevent flying around.
Easy Bluetooth connectivity to multiple devices.
Decent sound cancellation.

Cons:
Not as powerful or clear as higher-end headphones.
Grips provided with headphones are average-quality.
They stopped working on me.
Conclusion:
Great-quality headphones for the price until they stopped retaining battery charge.

Update!!!
I contacted the seller, explained the issue about the battery charge, and they sent me a new replacement free of charge. This new pair holds a charge much better than the initial ones, so I bringing my review back up to 4/5.

I have used other brands of around the neck headphones for years. I saw this on a lightening deal and decided to give it a shot. After a couple of weeks of use I really like them. The earbuds have little "arms" that help hold them in your ears. When working under a car or RV these are light enough that they don't tend to fall off as easily as others I have used. Plus they the ear pieces are held together magnetically if not in your ears. Therefore, when they have fallen off my neck while laying on the ground, they have stayed with me. I lost one pair of the other style when they fell off while working on an RV at a camp ground and did not remember that I had them on. I have used these for a number of phone conversations and have had no complaints that the person on the other end could not hear me.
The only negative that I have thus far is they don't tell you the battery level when you power them on. I forgot to charge them for 3 or 4 days and ran out of battery.

I gave this product 5 star when i purchased it cause i thought it was awesome tiny little thing.
