Paired with a Note 4.
First attempt to pair the phone failed to find them. I blame that on the phone because it's had a history, just like every Samsung phone I've had this century, of doing that so I turned them off then tried again. This time it found them and after what seemed like a year, finally paired BUT would play for a second, cut out for about 5 seconds, play a second, repeat. I unpaired them, turned off the earbuds, tried again. Within a second, success and they worked correctly.
Medium gels and ear clips (not sure what you call the wings) from the box sounded good, felt great, but no bass. I'm used to this with all in-ear buds so I did my usual change the gels to the large ones but kept the medium clips. Bass is incredible but highs are slightly muddy when using no EQ on the Power Amp music player.
Nose isolation is quite a bit, so much so I couldn't even hear the TV, family, grandchild, barking dogs and other usual noises in my world in the least. Once I turned on music the whole outside world was gone of noise. I definitely will not wear them both when driving as it reminded me of my days of mega way stereo days in my truck (I was one of those folks at a stop light that annoyed the crap out of everyone around}. But I digress
The left bud is the main one that controls everything, limited as the controls are. What I found was to decrease time from power on to listening to music or make a call was power up the left side then in the time it takes to switch what I'm paying attention to and power up the right, the left has connected to the phone, right side about a second later has connected to the left one and they're ready to go.
The only control on the units is power on/off by holding or tap left button to answer/end a call or in music tap either side opens up your voice prompt engine. This is easy to remember, as no clue tap this triple hold that to remember. It's also inconvenient when wanting to change tracks and/or volume without the music device within reach.
Battery life was about 2 hours on the first charge but sometimes lithium ion batteries will increase life between charges after about 3-7 charges by a discernible amount. Time will tell on this.
I didn't write much about the sound quality as that's a personal choice but I did find the medium gels to provide no bass (far too bright) to me and the large a slight bit too much bass (aka muddy) but voices were pretty natural on both.
Volume, again subjective, was plenty for me at just under middle on the phone, I actually prefer it just under that as a maximum when lightning for extended time.
Turn off either side and they both power off. I like that a lot. Powering up just the right one did nothing, this why I stated the left side has the main software and the right is slaved to it.
Since call clarity and all that stuff is also highly subjective I called the Plantronics test line (Google it as I'm not sure I'm allowed to post the actual phone number in a review) and recorded myself. My volume was plenty loud, their volume was loud but I could hear my low volume level television a little in the recording and my voice was very muddy, but understandable.
The fit, as I wrote above, is comfortable. Forget you're wearing them comfortable. They are feather light so they didn't move in the slightest as I tested them jumping up and down, shaking my head, etc. It's rare I find both comfort and no movement when moving around in earbuds. Now when I'm cutting grass and sweating profusely no more cord catching my neck and painfully yanking a bud out of my ear. They almost make me look forward to cutting my lawn on a hot humid day. Almost.
I'd thought briefly about similar buds by the same manufacturer as my phone but the price they wanted it was very brief. With the low asking price and only $3 for a Square Trade warranty extension (I deal with these folks at my job ,selling their product ,and they're easy to deal with and no hassle when trying to actually use the product) I took a shot and I'm glad I did.

I have to say righ off the bat that these are awesome for the price. No, these are not reference audiophile earbuds and for $30 no one should expect them to be. I own a pair of jbird x3, for working out, which cost from $99 to $129 depending on where you buy them. I had to send them in for warranty and wanted something to wireless to use in the meantime so I got these. Wow. I was expecting them to sound like total garbage and was planning to return them once I got my X3s back. There is no way I'm returning these. Yes they are missing some features like volume and track control, but again you can't go wrong for $30 wireless stereo earbuds. I can confirm that they are true stereo as I tested them with some tracks that have crazy right and left channel separation.

Beware though. I would knock off one star as the call quality is horrendous compared to the music sound quality. I was listening to music and decided to place a call. The person on the other line answered. The sound switched over to the left earbud only. The sound was kind of muffled and staticky. Once I ended the call, the music stayed in the left one only and I had to turn the Bluetooth on my phone off and then back on. Once they reconnected all was good.

I didn't knock off the star for the call quality but the music sound quality is really good for the price.

I'll start by saying that I honestly wanted to like these headphones. It's hard to find a solid set of wireless earbuds with decent sound quality and battery life even if you are willing to price up to Apple Airpod levels, so when I found these and I looked over the reviews and specs I was cautiously optimistic. On first glance they're slick looking and fit firmly and comfortably into your ear, and the charger/carrying case is conveniently sized and a great concept. And after charging them, a quick cycle through a variety of different musical genres left me pleasantly surprised by the actually-quite-decent sound quality (the deciding factor in giving them a 2 instead of a 1 star rating).
But the problems became apparent almost immediately. Though advertised as usable with one or both earbuds, only the left earbud actually connects to your device, while the right earbud appears to connect to the left earbud. As such, you can use either both pieces or just the left, but the right is effectively useless by itself (if you, as I do, prefer to have just the right earbud in, or if the left earbud dies). And the battery life is abysmal. I was skeptical when I couldn't find an estimated battery life anywhere in the product description, but shrugged it off when I saw words like "extended" and "surprising" in the reviews, thinking I would find myself with perhaps a 1 1/2 hour life for each earbud that I could charge with the case while using the other. This is sadly not the case. From full charge to unusable is -maybe- 45 minutes, and as I stated earlier, the right earbud is effectively useless by itself, so when the left one dies, you're out of luck for the two hours it takes to recharge. I make no assumptions about how effective the charging case battery is over time since I only bothered to fully charge the left earbud twice before becoming exasperated, but it was honestly underwhelming when I still had to pull out the regular headset after less than an hour.
I get that there's just not room to pack much battery into headphones this size, but given that this is such an obvious problem making one earbud completely dependant on the other seems like a massive design flaw. I really wanted these to work, but just came out feeling like I had bought a pair of headphones at a gas station.

I bought this pair of headphones on Amazon Prime Day when the price was at a low point and unfortunately have had issues with them charging since they arrived. I charged the case and the buds to full on arrival (film removed from buds as well) and the earbuds do not retain a full 2 hour charge as advertised.

I contacted the company and kindly requested a replacement unit and the response I received was "We are sorry that we are unable to arrange a replacement for you because the price is for mistake at that time and these cause a lot of loss for us."

They offered a refund for my price point, but I don't want the small refund, I want a pair of ear buds that work. They sound great when they're actually charged and I had no issues with dropping signal to either earbud, but if they only work for 20 minutes they aren't worth much.

This one surprises me as it is not the most expensive one but sounds great and maintains the connection. I wear it while I jogging in my neighborhood and there is not once an interruption. Easy to connect to cell phone. One thing some people may not like about it is the size of the ear buds is the comparable larger than those previous brands. I think this is also why it has strong signals. Battery is a bit short like 2 hours or so depending on how loud you listen to your music. When you buy a set of earbuds, you want to be able to listen to the music without distraction. So far, this is the best.

The concept of these headphones is great- true wireless, charging case, etc. However, they fall short when actually used- I have 7 sets of bluetooth headphones I use for the gym, so I have a wide experience on fit, sound quality and ease of use. These fit very well and don't fall out, but the problem is that the sound output is very low, even with my phone AND the headphones turned up to max. Overall I really like these earbuds as they are truly wireless. Opening the case they came in is fairly easy and getting the earbuds out is also simple. Pairing the earbuds was much easier than expected and is a matter of pushing a button on each one. After placing them in your ear you will notice how well they block out surrounding sounds and they are comfortable to wear although it might take some getting used to. They fit nicely inside the ear and don't fall out or move too much.
The sound quality it's self is very good although for me the volume wasn't loud enough. I had to turn my ipod high while working out and all the way up when mowing the lawn. Charging these is super easy by simply plugging the cord into the back while the earbuds sit inside. Overall, I am super happy with these and recommend them to anyone listening to music.

Super easy to pair up with my phone and the sound is very good. Please note only one earbud per order... this earbud is very small but with a powerful sound. There are a couple unique features with this earphone such as being able to pair up with a second mobile phone, you can connect with both phones at the same time and answer calls from one another. You can answer calls, reject incoming calls and end calls including last number redial or hang up current call while receiving another call... You can play music and there's a pause button
This is a super compact little earbud, I can see it coming in handy when you really don't want someone to know you're using headphones... I know for me it might be handy for work purposes.
It came in a very cool little compact black and orange case and included a usb charger, 3 sizes of silicone ear tips and the earbud. The earbud is made to be worn on either the right or the left ear. So super cool little item and I can't wait to try it out more

Best bluetooth headphones i have ever had. They are smaller than they look in the picture and stay in place while I workout. From weight lifting, treadmill, elliptical or biking they do not fall out. Battery life has lasted me a 3 hour bike ride. I love that the case is also a power bank capable of charging them about 3 more times before needing to be plugged in.

1 - Literally garbage
2 - You can find better
3 - Solid, maybe during a sale
4 - Good purchase
5 - There is literally no better version of this

These headphones are good; great, even. I buy a lot of headphones of all varieties and these genuinely surprised me with their quality. If I could go fractional, I'd go higher than a 4, but there are a few things that keep them from being a 5 in my opinion.

Good:

*Great price
*The case they come in charges the headphones.
*The fit is excellent; both the inner-ear plug and the concha bowl flare are separately interchangeable, so these will fit any ear.
*Sound quality is very nice, even before any "burn-in". I wasn't expecting much from the low ranges, but they genuinely surprised me. I think the benefits of Bluetooth V4.2 shine through here.

Bad:

*The only functional button is in a bad place: right on the center. I didn't find it comfortable to push the headphones into my ear with the force it took to depress the button, so it practically removed the convenience of one-finger operation. I'd rather have seen the button on the top or bottom of the earpiece so that you could press it with a pinching action instead of a pressing. On the same subject, not much is done with the function button. I'd either like to have seen more buttons for more function, or more creative things done. I've had single-button headphones that have separate uses for a short press, a long press, a double short press, a triple short press, etc. These are just start/stop.
*With the largest earpieces attached, there are issues fitting the headphones into the case. Mine are such a tight fit, it inverts the plug every time I try to remove them, no matter how gently. The concerns this brings to mind are faster wear on the soft plug and getting it stuck in the case if I try to remove it too fast and the plug gets ripped off the headphone.

---

TL;DR: These are really nice, especially for the price. Minor issues you could easily overlook keep it from being five stars.

I have been searching far and wide for a cost effective solution to running headphones. I will see that this mission began years ago when wireless headphones hadn't been invented yet. I used to hate running with ear buds. They would pop out and the cost would pull. I tried over the ear and behind the head and nothing fit the bill. Then I started looking at wireless headphones.

Now I should give a little background on how much I run and how often. I started out a year and a half ago wanting to run a 10k in 7:30 miles or faster. In July I began training and could only run maybe 1 mile at around 10:00 or so minutes. By thanksgiving I ran my 10k at 7:30 miles and now I am running much more. My hope this year is to run the 10k in less then 7:00 miles, but in addition I have added a lot of distance. I generally run around 20-25 miles a week and this year I will have run over 1,000 miles. I go on long runs that can be over two hours and as long as 15 miles. I only say that to give you some reference regarding my usage.

I would like to say that I don't care about the audio quality of the headphones within reason. I care about durability, fit, and functionality. The audio quality is just a bonus.

Little did I know that this would become a long and painful process. I will give you all my experience step by step in hopes of eliminating some of the pain and suffering that I endured flushing out all of my different options.

The very first set I tried were these Mpow headphones Mpow Swift Bluetooth 4.0 Wireless Sport Headphones Sweatproof Running Gym Exercise Headsets-Nature Green. It turned out that they were a little bit bulky and heavy right around the ear. This weight isn't much of an issue under normal usage, but between the weight and the wire and thousands of running strides they would shake lose and fall out. FAIL!

Having had some stability issues I decided to try something just a little different Anear Bluetooth Headphones Stereo Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds for Sport Running Gym Exercise Sweatproof CVC 6.0 Noise-Cancelling Wireless Bluetooth Earphones Microphone Compatible with iPhone 6, 6 Plus, 5 5c 5s 4 and Android--Black & Green. This set was similar, but it had an extra piece that I had hoped would provide me some more stability in my ear. Unfortunately the little extra piece that is attached to the bud did absolutely nothing to increase the stability and they would also fall out while I was running. FAIL!

So then I looked around and found the next logical step forward TaoTronics Bluetooth Headphones Wireless In Ear Earbuds Sports Sweatproof Earphones with Built in Mic (Cordless 4.1, Secure Ear Hooks Design, 7 Hours Play Time). These would definitely stay in place and in fact they did. These gave me a false sense of success. I really liked these headphones, but over time I found the wire running behing my neck was a bit of an annoyance. That wasn't enough to drive me away from the headphones, but when they stopped charging I had no choice. I wanted to find the perfect headphone and not one that was just good enough. The constant bouncing of the wire, even though it came with a little clip, drove me to look for something better. FAIL!

I must admit that this set of headphones was just a bad idea on my partBluetooth Headphones RIVERSONG Sweatproof Wireless Stereo Earphones Noise Cancelling Headphone Headset with Mic for iPhone, Samsung Galaxy and Android Phones (Black). In retrospect the lessons I learned earlier should have told me these wouldn't work, but I guess something made me think the smaller earbuds would be lighter and might not shift around as much. Unfortunately these were a very fast FAIL! The wire with the charging port in a little pod along the length is never a good idea for running. The momentum your running stride provides this piece will yank the bud out faster then you could stop and catch it as it falls to the ground. FAIL!

Finally I decided that the wire was an issue and had to go. With that in mind I entered the world of truly wireless headphones SoundPEATS Wireless Earbuds, True Wireless Stereo Bluetooth 4.2 Headphones Cordless Earphones Sweatproof In-Ear Headset with Mic, Secure Fit for Sports. Down the rabbit hole I went into chinese manufacturers rebranding and fake reviews. I really liked these headphones until the right now stopped charging after about 2 months. I got a replacement set and the left one did the same. I think the sweat was just too much for them to handle. I will also say that I wasn't terribly pleased with the customer service from these folks. FAIL!

Now that I did have a wire between the headphones to worry about I felt like maybe smaller would be better Mpow True Wireless Earbuds, V4.1+EDR Bluetooth Headphones with Magnetic Charging Box, Mini Stereo Bluetooth Earpiece Hands Free Headset Sport Earbuds w/ Mic. I tried these, but they just didn't say in my ears very well. Additionally I struggles with some connection issues. If I turned my head from left to right I would intermittently lose connection between the two headphones. Being that I run on the street/sidewalk I needed to be able to turn my head so I decided I needed something with better connectivity. FAIL!

Now these are a little gem Cobble Pro True Wireless Earbuds Bluetooth V4.1 In-Ear Earphones, Mini Twins Headphone Headset with Mic & Charging Carrying Case, Noise Cancelling & Sweatproof for Apple iPhone X/8/7/8 Plus, White. I really like these heardphones. Now after about 3 months the right one became really quiet, but the customer service was great and they sent me a new set. They didn't even make me return the old ones. The next set worked well for a while and then I must have jossled the magnet inside the left ear piece because it wouldn't sit on the charger correctly anymore. In general though they worked really well. The biggest issue I had was the right earpiece not staying in place. In fact it become common for me to simply pull it out and put it in my pocket during a run. NOT Fail! ALMOST THERE!

The mission now become to find a headphone with the same capabilities as the Cobble Pro's, but with more stability. That's what led me to regress back to the behind the ear design True Wireless Earbuds, DAVIKERY Bluetooth V4.2 Headphones HD Stereo Sound IPX5 Sweat & Water Proof Earphones with Mic for Gym Running Workout 8 Hour Battery Noise Cancelling Headsets - Black. I will keep this simple. They were nice for about 2 weeks and then they straight up stopped working. I think the design of the battery in the ear hook simply provided too much opportunity for moisture to get into the earpiece and killed them. EPIC FAIL! One of the worst sets for sure.

Now I just needed to find a new set without the batteries in the earhook Bluetooth Headphones SMARTOMI Gee True Wireless Earbuds Sport Earphones In Ear with Mic Bluetooth 4.2 Sweatproof Noise Cancelling Cordless Headset Running Sport Gym Soft Earhooks (Upgraded Version). These fit the bill, but unfortunately had MASSIVE connection issues. I didn't even get out of the house before these ones went back in the box. The ear pieces couldn't consistently stay connected to each other with me walking around the house. I wasn't going to even try going for a run. EPIC FAIL!

Maybe I needed something a little more Sporty Wireless Earbuds, NEXGADGET True Wireless Bluetooth V4.2 Headphones Sweatproof Cordless Sport Earphones Twins Stereo Headset with Mic for iPhone iPad and Most Android Phones. Flat out I just couldn't get these to fit right. I don't know if it is the flexible/moldable ear hook, or what it was, but they would not stay in my ear. FAIL for me!

FINALLY, that led me to the promised land. Now I write this review with a heart full of hopes and dreams that I am finally at the end of my journey, but I will admit that I am cautiously optimistic. I have gone on a slow recovery run and also a fast 6:45 min/mile 4.7 mile run. Usually my faster runs include more jostling and are worse for stability and the longer runs are worse for moisture. I haven't gotten in a really good long run yet, but the design provide me hope that water will stay out of this better. The small hook piece that goes inside your ear does a tremendous job providing the additional stability needed. They are really secure in my ears, use standard sized ear pieces (unlike the Cobble Pros) and sound pretty good. I gave these 5 stars and I hope that they stay that way. I will update this review as I learn more.
Won't charge fully, and can't connect to wi-fi

Unfortunately, this product is not the best. Only one side will work even when trying to use for dual listening. Additionally, the noise reduction isn't working. I got constant complaints about the background noise or inability to hear me. Wished I could have returned!!!

Just opened the box and within an hour one ear piece fell apart.

I charged them, changed the size of the airwings to fit my ear and listened to music for about 15 minutes. When I changed one of the air wings, the piece that goes into the ear fell off. I put it back on. I checked the other bud, and the ear insert was attached well. Then I put them back into their case for storage. I could not get the case to close. I took out one ear bud to look closer to see if I was putting it in the right way and see why the lid wouldn't close, and the entire insides came out. And I was gentle with them.

With only the one ear bud that was fine, I still cannot get the case to close or the receptors to line up for charging.

I'm so very disappointed. They seem to be great for everyone else. :(

For the first couple off weeks I've loved using this headphones. I used them for running and when I was working out. However as of the third week after arrival, the headphones make a scratch sound every 30 seconds, like the speakers are blown out.

This is a nice product. I hated the fact only device worked on a call. yes -- it is kinda cool that you could stream the call to one device and music to another device but that isn't what I wanted. If you look at the manufacturers website -- they clear state that fact right off-- so kudos to their website. Amazon choose to bury that information into the specifications. That is why I returned it. If you are looking for that feature to only use one device -- it is a great product. But if you are like me, want both earpieces working on a call -- look for an another device.

I give the manufacturer and device an 5 star but I give Amazon a 1 start for burying that information.

I've only had these earbuds for two days but my initial impressions are very good. I ordered wireless earbuds from the startup Kanoa almost two years ago and they still haven't been produced and shipped to me so I wanted to get some inexpensive wireless earbuds specifically for the gym. For $30 these have been great. I'm not an audiophile but I am happy with the bass, the overall sound, and the ease of use.
I've read that most people get about two hours of play time with these which is more than enough for me since I go to the gym on my lunch hour and won't need more than 45 minutes at a time. Some of the other reviews seemed repetitive and not very well written so I wasn't sure if they were genuine but now that I have these earbuds I can honestly say I am happy with this product so far.
UPDATE: I've had a few more days to use these earbuds and I had to reduce my rating from 5 stars to 4 stars because I experienced some connection issues when using this product while playing a solo round of golf. I was listening to music from a smartwatch which I wear on my right wrist (I'm left-handed). I was using a pull-cart while golfing and when I used my right hand to pull the cart my hand would trail behind me and the connection would fail. I ended up just pulling the cart with my left hand for the rest of the round and the connection issue was solved. I'm guessing the left earbud handles the pairing with my smartwatch, so it probably just disconnected when the watch and earbud got too far away from each other. Not a deal breaker, but notable.

Ok...may be too early to tell, BUT....I have a pair of QCYs and right out of the box, these OTIUMS are easily TWICE the sound quality. Maybe my QCYs were knockoffs because I have had quirky issues with them. I am enjoying tunes right this moment on the OTIUM set and quality is really better. The price is also much better. Although they are bigger and they do have the little silicone ear hook on them, they are definitely a great product. I know these won't fall out of my ears like the QCYs. Don't get me wrong, I do like the QCYs, especially since they were the intro to my true wireless experience....but I think the OTIUMS just beat them out. Now, this is my first day and this review may be updated...hopefully only for the good!

I really like these headphones I use them when I go for my morning jog. they actually stay in my ear when im running and i don't have to be afraid of them falling out. I also like the charging station/case it comes with and don't have to worry about plugging a annoying wire into the headphone just pop them in the case and they start charging. Love these would recommend.

I have had these for almost a week and I have found they they have good sound and I like the case that you charge them in. The cons are: I don't like that when you remove them from case the one on the right goes in the left ear and vice versa, very counter intuitive. I had to change out the earbud covers for the small ones, which was fine. And I had to take off the ear hooks, they seem to serve no purpose for my ears. Also, they do not keep a charge for an entire work day either, barely half a day. I start using them around mid-morning, turn them off for lunch and by 2:30 or 3:00, they are beeping because they need another charge. I guess I will have recharge during my lunch hour. I did not have to do that with my other bluetooth earbuds.

Super disappointed that they lasted for such a short period of time. Do not recommend unless you have back up headphone.

I was admittedly skeptical when I ordered these as I have traditionally been a name brand nerd. That being said these may have helped me turn a corner overall in that regard as I have absolutely nothing but praise for these earbuds. No issues connecting to myriad devices, great sound quality, outstanding durability (a full cycle through the washing machine and dryer), and most of all extremely comfortable! I have deleted bookmarks for buds from Sony, Samsung, and Beats at upwards of $200 because sans a back massage and a home cooked meal there is no way any of those warrant the premium price tag and would be hard pressed to win a Pepsi challenge straight up against these gems!

First off I like the earbuds design and fit and they sound great, only problem is mine seem to only last 20min on a full charge. Update- company contacted me and sent me replacement they work perfectly

Love the sound and fit from these earbuds. I bought these as a trial to see if I would like true wireless earbuds. These have convinced me that I do. Good "noise canceling". Not fond of the charging system. Earbuds won't charge when charger is plugged in so, you have to charge the charger first then place the earbuds in to charge them. If your earbuds are dead, and the charger is dead, it takes quite awhile to get the earbuds charged. The charger does not turn off after the earbuds are charged. This means that, if you place your dead earbuds in the fully charged charger to charge them, and you leave them in for an extended period, the charger goes dead. So, you can't store them in the charger beyond the charging time and expect to get more than 1 charge. Overall a good product just need to work on a couple things. I would not buy again but, if you are on the fence about getting true wireless earbuds, I feel these are a good initial buy because the price is right and you get very good sound.

When these things are used correctly, they sound great! The charging case is awesome, and does give me 2-3 full charges before I need to recharge the case itself. That's plenty of time for a couple flights + time to the hotel, which is exactly what I wanted. They fit well, and it's nice that they include several different sized ear fitments. The sound quality is awesome, they fit snugly and safely, and I didn't notice any fatigue from wearing them for several hours.

On the down side, these things are finicky as heck when you're trying to juggle one or both of them. Despite instructions (which are mediocre at best) and comments here, you almost have to re-pair these to use one or the other, depending on the situation. Like you start with both paired and the music playing and then one starts to die (battery), so you drop that one back into the charger and just use one. But now it doesn't want to work by itself, so you have to pair it again. And then when the first one is charged again, you need to re-pair BOTH to get them to work in concert. It's frustrating and annoying, but somehow, it's still worth it. I hate having cords laying around, stuff hanging on my neck, etc., so the hassle of pairing and re-pairing is tolerable for now. Someday it won't be, and I'll jettison these, but for now, it's okay. My second gripe is battery life. I don't think I've managed to get three hours on either ear piece. Maybe two hours, or 2.5 hours max. I really wish they lasted longer. If they DID last longer, then the whole issue with pairing becomes somewhat moot, as I won't have to do it as often. If someone comes out with a pair of these with a six hour battery life, then I'm all in, and these are toast.

Oh, the case is a bear to open when the ear pieces are charging. Which I guess is good, because you don't want to lose them, but just note it takes a fingernail to pry that sucker open. Finally, when you consider the COST for these things, well, they just can't be beat!
Great product, but the mic on the device is not that great.
they came in a very great case, it just the sound wasn't loud enough for me

The microphone quality is so poor that it is not realistic to use as a headset for conversation. Sounds like the user is in a tin box down the hall.
Sound/speaker quality was OK though.

1. I haven't ever been able to get earbuds to fit right. These fit perfectly out of the box. Comfortable, light, and seals out enough noise to make it feel like noise canceling.

2. These are hands down the BEST sounding, clearest, ACTUAL stereo, and deep bass headphones I've ever had, even Monster headphones aren't this good.

I love everything about these, and I haven't actually ever loved a headphone before. And they're actually wireless, no connector between the two of them. If you aren't sure, buy these. More expensive ones aren't needed.

The price is more than reasonable. The case is super cool, it has a little battery and charges the headphones when its not plugged in. they are comfortable and stay in your ear. However, these do have some issues staying sync'd, especially in areas with a lot of interference causing electronics and crowded areas, these have zero low end, terrible battery life (about 2 hours). I wouldn't purchase these again, however I don't regret purchasing them the first time.

I wish I had bought a pair of these a long time ago. They are so worth the purchase. Hands free driving covered. Listening while cooking no problem. Listening to music while house cleaning cleaning was done faster.

I am very surprised these worked as good as they do way cheap for the amount of sound and battery life. I go on 2hr runs with these they are very comfortable, no ache in my ears like some ear canal headphones. Very light very responsive.

I ordered this set of wireless headphones for my husband. He is very satisfied with this headphones so far. The sound quality is good. And it is very convenient to have wireless compared to wire headphone.

I really like these headphones I use them when I commute in the morning and afternoon on the walk to and from the train. They will actually stay in my ear and i am not worried of them falling out. Wish on next generation they work on battery life. I have recommended these to family, friends and coworkers.

Will give them a try at the gym with my phone. I wish my hearing aids charged like these......

Please don't waste your money like I did spend 10-20$ more and get a good pair!

Otherwise, the earbuds are pretty good. They stay in my ear perfectly. They drown out all the sounds around me. Connecting to my phone is very easy.

Very good headphones. You can use both left and right or just one of the earbuds. Very convenient case. Easy fit to my ears, didn't feel them at all, very lightweight. Good instructions and a lot of possibilities â€” read it carefully to use all the possibilities designed by a manufacturer.

Horrible product! I bought it in August and I only got to used it 2xs. This morning, as I was listening to music, the right piece just went out! I thought it went out of battery but nope! It went out forever!!! Waste of money. Horrible!

Update: These started acting odd - disconnecting from Bluetooth and then shutting down - after about a month of use. Now, two months into use, they refuse to connect to my phone or other Bluetooth devices at all. I've contacted Otium about a replacement. Will update when I hear back.

The design is nice and won't fall when moving so these are decent headphones for jogging. this is a great deal for 24$ as these have outperformed 60/70$ headphones in terms of quality. Good buy

I had high hopes for these headphones. After looking through many other headphones and their reviews, I chose to purchase this pair. It seemed like a great deal price to performance wise. The headphones had quality sound and were comfortable.

Now, fast forward to 3 months later. The headphones worked fine until one day at the gym. The right side of the headphones stopped working. The sound went in and out for a while until it immediately ceased to work. I put the headphones in a bowl of rice to see if it was due to sweat seeping in, but isnâ€™t that why theyâ€™re IPX7? After a night in the grains, nothing changed. I thought these headphones were the one, but now Iâ€™m stuck with listening to only leftsided audio. Iâ€™m very disappointed.

Thank you for your time.

I had another cheap pair of wireless headphones but those blow those out of the water! I love the sound and how you can control your music from the ear piece. I don't have a problem with these slipping off or anything as they fit secure around my ears. I've been using these at the gym for about 2 months now & I really love them. Definitely recommend!

These are quite nice. The tips are very soft in the ear and fit comfortably. The hooks are a bit large for my ears, but they stay snugly on my head when I'm moving around. It was very easy to pair and the controls are pretty straightforward. Volume levels were good; they can get surprisingly loud if you want them to. The case is quite nice and feels very sturdy. Definitely a good thing to have when traveling. Plus it comes with a 1 year warranty which is really nice.

As for the sound, they have a strong bass emphasis similar to Beats headphones. I prefer a flatter EQ personally, but I was able to tweak the EQ in spotify and other apps to get a flatter response. If you like Beats then you'll definitely like these. Kick drums and bass are very forward in the mix and if you're listening to podcasts then the voices will be a bit more boomy than you may be used to. Again, adjust the EQ if you have that option and want a flatter sound.

This is a great set of headphones! I am really happy that I got them. They are very comfortable, and fit over my ears great. It also included extra buds, but these were great. They connected to my android phone really easy, and they came pretty well charged. They seem well made, and I foresee them lasting a long time!

This si awesome. Sound quality is really good. I love bass and one of the factors for me when I buy a pair of headphone is if you can hear the bass or feel it. You can definitely hear and feel the bass a little. I literally got these therefore I'll do an updated review later when I test battery life etc. I work midnights and with the movements etc. of what I do when I work. I am confident that these will last a long time. So far a definently buy if your looking for headphones. I'll update this review tomorrow. If anything crazy happens with the headphones you'll know.

I have had these for 6 weeks and they just stopped working. Of course, they broke 20 days after they couldn't be returned. They are an absolute rip off. Do not waste your money. Now I have to find a new set.

This is so easy to use. Just turn on the earbud and the Bluetooth on your phone and connect. Sound quality is great, does not slip off the ears. The box also comes with three replicable earbuds, a charger, and a manual. Thumbs up!

First of all, I have to commend the seller for extremely fast delivery. I am pleased with this aspect. The package came in perfect condition, and the set up for these earphones are so simple. I would say it took me no less than 3 mins to actually connect the bluetooth to my phone and use it immediately. They come in the cutest little carrying case, with a keychain hook that you can connect to your belt or keys or hydroflask for when you're at the gym. I listened to the quality and they are crisp and clear, and the bass filled my ears perfectly. There's also a mic on the earphones, so this is a way better deal than spending $200 on iPhone wireless earpods. It fits my ears well, and if my boyfriend wants to use it, he can switch out the ear padding to fit his ear size and vice versa. It's comfortable, so that's a huge reason I got these. Definitely recommend to those college students trying to save money on wireless earphones!

Sleek and modern headphones fit snugly around my ears, and I can mold the plastic slightly in order to make them fit my ear better - which is nice. I really like the red color and feel that they stand out while I'm taking a walk or run.

The sound quality of these earbuds are nice, and I love that I can hook it up to my phone and use it around the house, or while I'm out. The cord is a really good material and feels soft and sleek to the touch. Charging these earbuds is pretty painless as well, and doesn't take a lot of time! They also come in a cool zipper container that protects them in my bag!I highly recommend these!

I am a late adopter when it comes to the wireless/blue tooth game. This is due mainly to the reports on battery life, and loss of signal while listening to music/podcasts etc., from personal sources and forums. The sound of this product is sufficient for most genres of music. This product seems to have an issue with really intricate metal, however it still sounds better than most in ear headphones. Your more mainstream genres such as Classical, Jazz, POP, Electro, Rock, Country, R&B, Hip Hop, et cetera sound great. I purchased these during a flash sale for 16.00 USD. Definitely worth your money. I will update when the battery life starts to dissipate so that future consumers will be made aware of the average product life.

Bought this as an "Employee of the Month" gift for my company. When I got it, I had to test it out, and I gotta say, it works very well. Charges fast, easy to install onto your device (I used my iPhone) and the sound quality is pretty good. It's no Bose or Sennheiser level of quality, but it'll hold it's own against a pair of Skullcandy earbuds. You're also not paying Bose level prices either - hence the gift idea. I figure 25 bucks a month is worth it if my productivity increases.

But now I'm considering keeping them and getting something else for a gift. We'll see.

Very good Bluetooth headphones with one exception that almost made me return them. The bass, arghhh the base is way out of proportion. Please stop with the over emphasis on this one component of music, what is it with everyone jumping on the over use of bass in their music. Bass is one of many components that make music beautiful and it plays an important part yes but it is not the holy grail. At first I could barely make out the vocals and other instruments due to the extreme bass incorporated into this product. I was about to return them hoping to find a more balanced set of headphones. BUT then I remembered oh ya they make equalizers just for this very purpose. To fine tune the listening experience to your satisfaction. Since these will only ever be used (in my case) with a smartphone or iPAD this was a simple fix. Now my music is almost just how I want it. Iâ€™ll be tweaking the sound for a little longer until I get it just right. Donâ€™t be afraid of equalizers if you have never used one. Donâ€™t panic take a screenshot of the initial settings for reference and then just dive in and play with all the sliders, you will know when you have come close to your preferred setting, problem solved.

OK NOW THE GOOD! These feel really good on my earlobes and in my ears, just really comfortable. Even without music on these block what I think is a good amount of distracting noise. There are many Bluetooth headphones that are very similar to these but these had a slight style advantage over most that I came across. The price was reasonable and the construction feels very solid. The buttons are all in the right place and easy to identify. I like the silicone cord tightening piece, I donâ€™t like things dangling near around my head very distracting and I inevitably get the cord caught on something and yank my headphones right out of my ears...aggravating. These are also very loud when set to the upper settings, I donâ€™t advise it, seriously a bad idea and the music gets very distorted at the uppermost range. But I have to admit I do like the freedom to destroy my ears if I want too. Too much product nannying going on these days, I cry FREEDOM! Ok thatâ€™s a bit extreme but the point is made.

For the price I think these are hard to beat, I did a lot of researching because I am insane enough to drive myself loony comparing devices, options available, reviews and style within a price range that doesnâ€™t send me into and obsessive compulsive spiral to keep them perfect.... believe me you donâ€™t ever wanna know what thatâ€™s like.

To sum it up these are a very good choice in my opinion, only time will tell. You should certainly pay the $20 admission fee to try them out. Download a high rated free equalizer app that doesnâ€™t demand permissions the app has absolutely no reasonable explanation for needing. Happy Listening ðŸ‘‚!

I'm a little bit of an audiophile and a gym junkie in the works. I do a lot of different workouts that include running/springs/HIIT/etc. These do an amazing job of staying in place and I have had zero issues with sound skipping. I actually was running lines today at the gym so I took my phone out of my pocket and put it on the ground and my signal never cut out, I was running between 5 - 35 feet away from my phone and it was crystal clear the whole time! The sound quality is also up there with some mid-level headphones I have owned. Not quite the quality of a Shure IEM, but much better than anything you can get at this price range and better than some I've had in the $30-$50 range. I've had them for around a month now and will update if anything changes, but these have been nothing short of awesome since day one. I also got four solid 1 - 1.5 hour workouts without needing to charge and actually never got a low battery signal even prior to charging.

I don't usually write reviews but I wanted to post a quick tip to those that don't want any brands or colors. I was able to black out these headphones by using a plain sharpie. Just go over the headphone brand and color. The sharpie will leave a glossy residue then just use your finger over the glossy residue and the resulting finish matches the flat black rubbery coating of these headphones. The blacked out finish seems to last since I've had the headphones. I also used some black ear buds I had from another headphone.

Overall, I would rate these headphones great. The sound is a bit bass heavy but the sound isolation is amazing as well as how light these are. Another peeve is the voice that states the headphones are on or off. Otherwise, well worth the purchase.

These are amazing headphones! They are the most comfortable headphones I've ever worn! They sit perfectly on my ear and feel like they can be worn for hours without discomfort! Love these bluetooth earbud-type headphones! I love music, but am not super picky about sound in headphones, but these sound great! They stay on my ears and it is so nice to not have a cord in the way, this is my first pair of bluetooth headphones. I bought 5 pair of these as gifts, as well as my pair. So far, everyone is happy with the gift. They connect very easily to our phones, all iPhones. I've also paired them to my MacBook and iMac. I would highly recommend these for sound quality and ease of use!

These WILL NOT stay in ears, no matter which ear buds are used. Completely useless for running, since they require me to hold them in my ears the entire time. Wish I had chosen to spend more money for a higher quality product.

These headphones are not "noise cancelling" as listed in the description; they are sound-isolating in that they behave like ear plugs with speakers, rather than actively removing background noise as the description implies. If you are looking to buy these as a "noise cancelling headset" (like a Bose headset) you will want to look elsewhere.

That said, as a basic bluetooth headset, these aren't bad. The ear clips are a little flimsy and don't provide a positive feel for being held in, rather they are just to keep the earpiece from falling to the ground when (not if) the friction fit of the earbud gives way. A stiffer material would go a long way in this area.
Sound quality is good, bass is more pronounced than typical of a small speaker like this. Mids and highs are a little muted/muddy, but can typically be compensated for with the music app of your choice (or a sound equalizer app).

All in all - I wouldn't purchase these again at full price, but as a lightning deal they are a decent set of bluetooth earbuds. There are much better available in the price range.

These are OK ONLY because the ear wraps are way too flimsy. If the ear wrap were more sturdy then Id have given this a 5 star. The ear wraps are designed to keep the pods in your ear, but these are so loose that the pods often wiggle out causing you to continue to press the pods back in your ears. If the ear wraps were sturdy enough to actually press the pods into your ears slightly this product would definitely be a five, but as it stands it's only ok, especially for someone with larger ears.

Just picked these up on a cyber monday lightning deal. Very happy - only took a star off because it's not perfect.

Pros:
Great price for the sound quality
They are LOUD - very freaking loud. I'm actually going hard in the paint right now with these on.
Good design, stays on my ears
Comfortable for long wear
Easy to pair
1 year warranty from the company
Little carry case that I may or may not use

Cons:
Wire is a little long for my liking - however it doesn't bounce around and fly everywhere. Overall, I would definitely recommend these headphones. Especially at the price.

Summary: The sound is actually phenomenal - it exceeded my expectations. High quality across the board - good bass as well. The headphones are comfy but the only complaint I have is that it's just too much extra wire hanging from the back. Wish the wire was a few inches shorter because there is no reason for the extra slack in the back - nobody has a head that big.

When I first bought the this wireless (Bluetooth) headphones I was skeptical because of two reasons. Losing connection/the music cutting out and the quality of the sound. But after using the headphones I was pleasantly surprised. Not once did the music cut out or I have to reconnect and the quality is top of the line. On top of this the buds did not fall out of my ear once and not having to worry about the cords getting in the way is awesome. I highly recommend the product.

Used it for 2 days, but only charged once. Nice battery life. I love the design of 3 buttons control everything. Power button easy to press to answer the calls. And the button is well hidden as the icon. I didn't find it first time hands on it. Volume buttons are able to control the volume and next songs for android phone apps.

Love this headphone while sporting and in the car.

Used for 3 weeks now. Very much as described. Last more than a full day of work with music (over 8 hours) and charge in the 1.5 hours as described. Took a few days for me to find a comfortable fit angle, but once found they are very comfortable and secure, though probably not wedged in deep enough for full noise cancelling. Fully inserted they were just not comfortable to my ear shape/size, but I wouldn't expect everyone to have a perfect fit.

I've done two mile runs with zero jiggle or fear of falling out. Sound clarity is way above what the cost is. The Bass is maybe not as deep as they describe, but still plenty. Overall they sound great and un-muddled.

One issue I've had is wind noise. I think this has to do with the wire being towards the front of the ear piece. That said, it's not that much and I just crank up the volume a bit more than in a non-wind situation.

The only other issue I've had is that when using two devices, one tends to completely dominate. This may be more to do with setting on my devices though than the headphones and not really a huge deal.

You can't go wrong on this purchase at this price.

These earphones are awesome. Great sound quality. Crystal clear. Exactly as described and what I expected. Very comfortable. Doesn't make your ears sore. My kids love them. Easy to set up Bluetooth and connect to your phone. Very good quality and very durable! Highly recommended! Would definitely purchase again!

These heads phones work well in the respect that they connect to your phone easily and they sound.....pretty good for the money. However I'm an audiophile, I actually mix tracks for a living so I don't know how I ever thought that these headphones which were on sale for like 16 bucks on sale...normally like 27 were going to live up to my demands. I guess I just couldn't pass up a smokin deal. That and I trusted the majority of the reviews which said great things about these.

At the end of the day I was seriously concerned about using wireless headphones at all considering how much quality gets lost in the air when you lose the cord with headphones, let alone when dealing with cheaper ones. Now...let me just say ...I am knocking these headphones...but considering they were as cheap as they were, I almost feel guilty about it because back in the day when I was a kid....this kind of quality would have been impossible for this price...if at all. So it's cool to think about how far we've come.

But as my video review says..overall they're 7 out of 10. The sound is actually surprisingly good...and they do get loud...so you can push them a bit. But the sound does start to come apart. There's not much low end bass...so whoever made them tries to make up for that with some high bass that sounds kinda cardboardish sounding. Hallow you could say...right about 300 HZ which I tried to EQ out with my phone to get them to sound better. It kinda worked but not altogether and they still left me wanting more. Much more.

Do they work well enough for an hour at the gym for 16 bucks..yes. Am I surprised at the sound....yes....amazed..NO! But am I amazed at how much you can get for 16 bucks all in?...yes. But here is the real question that matters. Will I ALWAYS be thinking to myself about how much I wish I had a better pair while I'm wearing them. HELL YES.

With that being said,...I think this is one of those situations where you actually get more than you pay for...but even saying that...they still aren't up to the standards of what I would expect with a rockin pair of bluetooth headphones. So I wouldn't buy again...unless I just wanted a throw away pair of blue tooth headphones.

Regards!

I was looking for long lasting (battery) headphones for work. I work overnight & I had trouble finding headphones that would actually last 8 hours in one charge. I came across this product & let me tell you, itâ€™s great. The headphones are comfortable & the battery life is more than I expected. In one single charge I got 11 hours on a moderate volume level. Really easy to connect to phone. They come with a nice case that fits the headphones, charger cable & the ear bud replacements. The sound quality cannot be compare to jbl, beat or apple headphones but itâ€™s not awful. Only complain would be that usually around 20% charge you get the notification the battery life is low. Instead of just one simple noticed, the notification keeps repeating itself again & again (voice notification) which can get a little annoying specially if you hear it the first time. They also come with a 6 month free warranty in case anything goes wrong with the product. You need to register on their website (easy process) & can be helpful since you get updates & if you want to purchase or extend your warranty you can do it online. Overall Iâ€™m happy with this headphones & I would buy again.

Pros:
-Long lasting battery life
-Comfortable
-Water/sweat resistant
-Good looking product
- Free 6 month warranty

Cons
-Low Battery Notification (so far)

great headphone and great sound, it doesn't fall off your ears even jumping around, lasts long, charges well, Extremely pleased with these buds.

I wanted something to take to the gym but didn't want to spend too much. The built and overall quality are ok for the price, they look cost efficient (not to say cheap). What really surprised me was the Bluetooth part, they connect right away, no problems at all at least on my iPhone. The connection is very good, no drops or noise, I tested the range inside my gym leaving my phone on my bag and they worked fine (no walls) for more than 30 feet. I even had my heart rate monitor (Wahoo) connected also all the time while listening music, no problem. I even got phone calls, excellent plus if you don't want to reach for your phone while working out. They fit nice around the ear, I do weight lifting and some cardio (bike or elliptical) so they don't move to much, I don't know if they would be as confortable for a runner, I'm guessing maybe not (be sure to try all tip sizes). I really like them, given the price I would keep the four star rating if they go for more than 1 year of use, which i think the will accomplish easily, but you never know. Then If I like them so much why not give them 5 stars?... Well here is the thing, the sound. They could sound so much better than they do just by setting them to a "flatter" response curve, I'll explain my self: It looks like they wanted these to sound heavy on the low end and adjusted them to give more volumen there sacrificing quality (they sound a little distorted). I know they are not audiophile or high quality audio headphones, but if they change the response curve lowering the low end volume they could sound so much better. The high end is there, a little rolled down but that's expected for the price range. The good news is you can use your phone's adjustments or equalizer to tame the low end to your liking which eliminates the distortion. Over all I enjoy my new headphones, the package was cardboard which I like, and they came with 3 different size earplugs. They came with a case, nice addition, but I find it a little too big, I wish it was smaller and the soft kind, nevertheless it is still very convenient.
My last pair of these broke as the power button failed but I do love these and I love the fact that they will replace them for free if you have any issues-

Amazing sound quality, simple to use but they just donâ€™t want to stay in your ear for shit. Great sound with long lasting power. Great buy. I have had them over 60 days and working great and last long time with continuous YouTube music
I like the look, functionality, etc. I think the battery life is 7/10, the main issue is I wish there was more bass boost but for the price you can't beat it.

So far, so good. No complaints from callers about background noise. Clear. Holding charge very well at this point. My only complaint is the in ear fit. I just can't seem to manage a fit that feels snug in that area. The "sweet spot" as others have called it. Perhaps a different ear canal piece is in order for my ear. Even still, I can hear clearly.
